title: Confusing and unexplained ban system?
body:
Me and a couple friend live together and all play LoL. we swap computers often and have all played on eachothers PCs multiple times.

The other day one of our friends tried logging in and was greeted by a message that said they were banned due to 3rd party programs.

upon asking about the ban and how it came to be, we were told nothing but that riot cannot explain how their anti cheat system works. They also stated it was not an accidental ban, but was intentional and would not be lifted.

I really need clarity on this, I do not understand how one account can be banned that four other account have used the same pcs.
none of us use 3rd party and have all shared the same pc.

How is no other account banned for the same reasons as the first one?

 Is there no way to get this pointed out and fixed? it is clearly a mistake yet they won't listen to anything.

replies.body:
I went ahead and pulled up the chat you were having with Deme, and it looks like the agent did explain why he was unable to talk to you about this account being banned. You already mentioned you aren't the original creator of the account so sadly we can't go into detail on that suspension. 

The reason that only one account was punished is most likely because that one account was the only one detected running third party programs. It's likely your friend might have had something running in the background which was detected. Again, our agents can't discuss this account with anyone except for the original creator, but we can absolutely go into more detail with them in a ticket.

During my talk with Deme, my friend who was banned was talking to another mod about it.

They wouldn't tell them anything at all either.

They wouldn't explain anything or mention anything.
It was literally like talking to a brick wall.
There was no support or help or explanation to clarify what is happening.

None of us use third party programs and only one account being banned permanently makes no sense.

Is there some sort of appeal process to this?
Is it possible to send files in, or anything to have it cleared up?
Or even actually explained to the owner of the account?

There is clearly some sort of mistake happening but nobody wants to own up to it.

I don't mean to sound rude, but when someone tells you something was done and they have proof of it and it won't be reverted.
When infact they are wrong and nobody did anything is a little frustrating.

We can't comment on anything pertaining to an account unless talking with the original account creator. I do have that chat log pulled up, and Deme was able to explain why we can't disclose info about someone elses account, as well as why we can't say specifically what programs were detected.

I can't say much about what happened in your friends ticket because A) That was his ticket and it wouldn't be right to disclose that info and B) I don't have that ticket info to even pull it up. I can say for sure that if your friend still has questions about what happened, *they* can open up a ticket to open that discussion back up. However we won't be able to discuss their account without anyone except the creator.

I know. I understand you can;t talk about their account with me.

That is very clear.

You still did not answer if there is a process to have a ban appealed/lifted?

That is the main concern.

The system made a mistake, we just want if resolved.

I mentioned in my most recent post, your friend or anyone else is more than welcome to shoot us a ticket to open up the discussion about why a ban was placed on their account and if anything can be done about it.

That is what I mentioned before.

We made a ticket. Asked.
And they replied with "It was not a mistake, this ban was placed for a reason and I will not be lifting it."

Exactly why I made another ticket and tried to talk to someone else.

This was a mistake, but they don't seem to accept that.

I wanted to know if there was another way to appeal to the ban?B
you could open up another ticket. That answer sounds like it came from someone who was having a bad day.
